ai-thag16.4:8.1_0: “I see rich people in the world who,
ai-thag16.4:8.2_0: because of delusion, give not the wealth they’ve earned.
ai-thag16.4:8.4_0: yearning for ever more sensual pleasures.
ai-thag16.4:9.1_0: A king who conquered the earth by force,
ai-thag16.4:9.2_0: Inhabited earth, up to the ocean’s edge,
ai-thag16.4:9.3_0: unsatisfied with the near shore of the ocean,
ai-thag16.4:9.4_0: would still yearn for the further shore.
ai-thag16.4:10.1_0: Not just the king, but others too,
ai-thag16.4:10.2_0: reach death not rid of craving.
ai-thag16.4:10.3_0: They leave the body still wanting,
ai-thag16.4:10.4_0: for in this world sensual pleasures never satisfy.
ai-thag16.4:11.3_0: They take out the body wrapped in a shroud,
ai-thag16.4:11.4_0: heap up a pyre, and burn it there.
ai-thag16.4:12.1_0: It’s poked with stakes while being burnt,
ai-thag16.4:12.4_0: can’t help you when you’re dying.
ai-thag16.4:13.2_0: while beings fare on according to their deeds.
ai-thag16.4:13.3_0: Riches don’t follow you when you die;
ai-thag16.4:14.3_0: for the wise say this life is short,
ai-thag16.4:15.2_0: the fool and the wise feel it too.
ai-thag16.4:15.3_0: But the fool lies stricken by their own folly,
ai-thag16.4:15.4_0: while the wise don’t tremble at the touch.
ai-thag16.4:16.1_0: Therefore wisdom’s much better than wealth,
ai-thag16.4:16.2_0: Whatever of your enemy you will achieve
ai-thag16.4:16.3_0: But if because of delusion you don’t reach consummation,
ai-thag16.4:17.1_0: One who enters a womb and the world beyond,
ai-thag16.4:17.3_0: While someone of little wisdom, placing faith in them,
ai-thag16.4:17.4_0: One who enters a womb and the world beyond,
ai-thag16.4:18.1_0: As a bandit caught in the door
ai-thag16.4:18.2_0: is punished for his own bad deeds;
ai-thag16.4:18.3_0: so after departing, in the world beyond,
ai-thag16.4:18.4_0: is punished for his own bad deeds;
ai-thag16.4:19.1_0: Sensual pleasures are diverse, sweet, delightful;
ai-thag16.4:19.2_0: appearing in disguise they disturb the mind.
ai-thag16.4:19.3_0: Seeing danger in the many kinds of sensual stimulation,
ai-thag16.4:20.1_0: As fruit falls from a tree, so people fall,
ai-thag16.4:20.3_0: Seeing this, too, I went forth, O King;
ai-thag16.4:20.4_0: the ascetic life is guaranteed to be better.”
ai-thag16.4:21.4_0: so I enjoy my food free of debt.
ai-thag16.4:22.1_0: I saw sensual pleasures as burning,
ai-thag16.4:22.3_0: conception in a womb as suffering,
ai-thag16.4:23.3_0: I was stabbed, but then I found peace,
ai-thag16.4:24.3_0: The heavy burden is laid down,
ai-thag16.4:24.4_0: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.
ai-thag16.4:25.2_0: from the lay life to homelessness.
